wikipedia_page.main: Roula Khalaf (Arabic: رولا خلف) is a British-Lebanese journalist who is the editor of the Financial Times, having been its deputy editor and foreign editor. She succeeded Lionel Barber as editor on 20 January 2020.

link_mentions.page: List of newspapers in the United Kingdom

response: The editor of the FT Roula Khalaf who took the decision to withdraw the initial article, acknowledged having been contacted by the Élysée regarding the article and defended her decision on the basis purely of several factual errors in the original piece by Mehreen Khan.

link_mentions.page: Mass media in the United Kingdom

response: Barber was the second longest-serving editor in the FTs history (after Sir Gordon Newton), having stepped down on 17 January 2020 after 14 years. He was succeeded by Roula Khalaf.
